TextBody:
Hi Franklin,

Can you please let me know what EPP server version you are using and what EPP client versions you have installed on those computers?
Initially the issue was reported on the 5.6.0.0 EPP server version with 2640 and 2842 EPP client versions. There was a fix implemented regarding this in the 5.9.1.0 EPP server and its corresponding client version.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.
ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref
Subject: EPP client not reading external drives after approving them    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref

Hi Support

Apologies for the delay. Please let me know if we can jump on a call and
try to resolve this as this is becoming a major issue for our MacOS users .
To confirm we are on EPP Server version :  5.9.3.0

We tested on both Client version 2.9.0.7 and tested again on 3.0.1.2 and
both times it also failed to be ready within Finder

Its odd because the EPP client shows the device but does not turn the
status to "allow status" even though it accepted the one time passcode. It
keeps the device in a grey status . The laptop itself cannot even detect
its on the device

Kind Regards,


<http://www.sitetracker.com>

———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com <yourname@sitetracker.com>

www.sitetracker.com
<https://www.linkedin.com/company/sitetracker>
<https://twitter.com/SitetrackerInc>
<https://www.facebook.com/Sitetracker>

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref
 
Hi Support 
 

Apologies for the delay. Please let me know if we can jump on a call and try to resolve this as this is becoming a major issue for our MacOS users . 

To confirm we are on EPP Server version :  5.9.3.0 

 

We tested on both Client version 2.9.0.7 and tested again on 3.0.1.2 and both times it also failed to be ready within Finder 

 

Its odd because the EPP client shows the device but does not turn the status to "allow status" even though it accepted the one time passcode. It keeps the device in a grey status . The laptop itself cannot even detect its on the device 



Kind Regards, 

 



———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com

www.sitetracker.com

From: Franklin Pavon [fpavon@sitetracker.com]
Sent: 6/17/2024 11:19 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411287 - ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref - EPP client not reading external drives after approving them [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref
 
Hi Support 
 

Apologies for the delay. Please let me know if we can jump on a call and try to resolve this as this is becoming a major issue for our MacOS users . 

To confirm we are on EPP Server version :  5.9.3.0 

 

We tested on both Client version 2.9.0.7 and tested again on 3.0.1.2 and both times it also failed to be ready within Finder 

 

Its odd because the EPP client shows the device but does not turn the status to "allow status" even though it accepted the one time passcode. It keeps the device in a grey status . The laptop itself cannot even detect its on the device 



Kind Regards, 

 



———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com

www.sitetracker.com 
      




 


On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 6:08?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Franklin,

Can you please let me know what EPP server version you are using and what EPP client versions you have installed on those computers?
Initially the issue was reported on the 5.6.0.0 EPP server version with 2640 and 2842 EPP client versions. There was a fix implemented regarding this in the 5.9.1.0 EPP server and its corresponding client version.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411287 - - EPP client not reading external drives after approving them    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref

Hi

I have great news -- I figured out the issue and was able to resolve it to
a degree.

Our mdm tool, Mosyle, had a setting that was blocking external media from
being mounted. We have disabled it and it is now working fine. The one
pending issue is that it not installing with full disk access, although it
works without it I assume for best performance and results we need to
enable it

Kind Regards,


<http://www.sitetracker.com>

———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com <yourname@sitetracker.com>

www.sitetracker.com
<https://www.linkedin.com/company/sitetracker>
<https://twitter.com/SitetrackerInc>
<https://www.facebook.com/Sitetracker>

TextBody:
Hi Franklin

Happy to hear that!
Can you check if it's possible to enable Full Disk Access from Mosyle when it's installing the client?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411287 - - EPP client not reading external drives after approving them [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref
 
Hi 
 

I have great news -- I figured out the issue and was able to resolve it to a degree. 

 

Our mdm tool, Mosyle, had a setting that was blocking external media from being mounted. We have disabled it and it is now working fine. The one pending issue is that it not installing with full disk access, although it works without it I assume for best performance and results we need to enable it 

 



Kind Regards, 

 



———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com

www.sitetracker.com

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref

at a system level and not visible on the user side

One more additional question. How can we whitelist a specific storage
device for all computers?

Once you can point us to that resource we can now formally close this
ticket and mark it as resolved.

Kind Regards,


<http://www.sitetracker.com>

TextBody:
Hi Franklin,

By a specific storage device, do you mean a network share or something similar?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer

From: Franklin Pavon [fpavon@sitetracker.com]
Sent: 6/27/2024 12:06 AM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411287 - - EPP client not reading external drives after approving them [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref
 
I just got confirmation that full disk access is needed being given but its at a system level and not visible on the user side 
 

One more additional question. How can we whitelist a specific storage device for all computers? 
 

Once you can point us to that resource we can now formally close this ticket and mark it as resolved. 



Kind Regards, 

 



———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com

www.sitetracker.com 
      





 


On Wed, Jun 26, 2024 at 4:57 PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Franklin

Happy to hear that!
Can you check if it's possible to enable Full Disk Access from Mosyle when it's installing the client?

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.


--------------- Original Message ---------------
From: Franklin Pavon [fpavon@sitetracker.com]
Sent: 6/26/2024 9:55 PM
To: techsupport@netwrix.com
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #411287 - - EPP client not reading external drives after approving them [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0BXa4p:ref ]

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000BXa4p:ref
 
Hi 
 

I have great news -- I figured out the issue and was able to resolve it to a degree. 

 

Our mdm tool, Mosyle, had a setting that was blocking external media from being mounted. We have disabled it and it is now working fine. The one pending issue is that it not installing with full disk access, although it works without it I assume for best performance and results we need to enable it 

 



Kind Regards, 

 



———

Franklin Pavon

Senior IT Analyst, Sitetracker

fpavon@sitetracker.com

www.sitetracker.com

Hi Support 
 

Apologies for the delay. Please let me know if we can jump on a call and try to resolve this as this is becoming a major issue for our MacOS users . 

To confirm we are on EPP Server version :  5.9.3.0 

 

We tested on both Client version 2.9.0.7 and tested again on 3.0.1.2 and both times it also failed to be ready within Finder 

 

Its odd because the EPP client shows the device but does not turn the status to "allow status" even though it accepted the one time passcode. It keeps the device in a grey status . The laptop itself cannot even detect its on the device 



Kind Regards,

On Thu, Jun 6, 2024 at 6:08?PM Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com> wrote:


Hi Franklin,

Can you please let me know what EPP server version you are using and what EPP client versions you have installed on those computers?
Initially the issue was reported on the 5.6.0.0 EPP server version with 2640 and 2842 EPP client versions. There was a fix implemented regarding this in the 5.9.1.0 EPP server and its corresponding client version.

Best regards,
